summary: WITHOUT WARNING ALL HEADLAMPS WENT OUT DRL,LOW BEAMS AND HIGH BEAMS. ALL OTHER LIGHTS WORKED OK. NOT FUN AT NIGHT TO HAVE OCCUR. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE DOOR LOCKS WOULD NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY. SHE NOTICED THAT THE DOOR LOCK PINS WOULD FREEZE IN COLD WEATHER. THE DEALER WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED OF THE PROCEDURE THAT WOULD HAVE TO BE PERFORMED IN ORDER TO MAKE REPAIRS. THERE WERE NO REPAIRS MADE TO THE VEHICLE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 100,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 200,000.
VEHICLE AIR BAG DIDN'T DEPLOY WHEN I CRASHED INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE DOING BETWEEN 30-40 MPH.  IMPACT WAS MAINLY ON THE DRIVER SIDE FRONT END. I WAS DRIVING AN CHEVY 1999 EXPRESS 1500 VAN.  *NM

DT :  THE POWER STEERING PUMP  SHAFT BROKE INSIDE THE PUMP ON JULY 14, 2000, THE DEALER REPLACED IT UNDER WARRANTY. ON SEPTEMBER 23, 2005 IT BROKE AGAIN, TOOK VEHICLE  TO THE DEALER AGAIN, AND THEY DID REPLACE IT.  HOWEVER,  THEY CHARGED THE CONSUMER  $636.00. THE STEERING  LOCKED AND THAT WAS HOW CONSUMER DISCOVERED THE FAILURE.  THERE WAS NO PRIOR WARNING. THIS HAPPENED ON A DRY PAVED ROAD AND  IN WARM WEATHER. *AK  *NM

1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS SPARE TIRE FELL OFF WHILE DRIVING.  *TS  THE SPARE TIRE WAS ATTACHED WITH A STEEL CABLE TO THE REAR UNDERSIDE OF THE VAN.  WHEN THE STEEL CABLE BROKE THE TIRE BOUNCED UNDER THE TOW TRAILER BENDING IT'S AXLE.   THE CONSUMER BELIEVES THE CABLE MAY NOT HAVE BEEN STRONG ENOUGH.  *NM

DT: THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS 3500 VAN. THE HINGE ON THE DOUBLE DOORS ON THE SIDE FROZE,  THEY WILL NOT OPEN ANYMORE. PREVIOUSLY,  THEY WHERE HARD TO OPEN, AND NOW THEY ARE CRACKING. THE DEALERSHIP SAID THIS WAS BAD DESIGN. ALSO,  DEALERSHIP TOLD HER THAT THERE WAS  BACK ORDER ON THE HINGES.  OBVIOUSLY A LOT OF PEOPLE WERE HAVING SIMILAR PROBLEMS. THE CONSUMER  RAN  A DAY CARE CENTER.  IT WAS   DIFFICULT FOR CHILDREN TO GO FROM THE FRONT OF THE VAN TO THE BACK. IN  AN EMERGENCY IT WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE TO GET THE CHILDREN OUT OF THE VAN  FAST ENOUGH. *AK

DT:  1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS.  THE SHAFT ON THE POWER STEERING UNIT BROKE.  THE CONSUMER STATES THE POWER STEERING INSTANTLY QUIT WORKING ON THE VEHICLE. THERE WAS NO WARNING.  THEY TOOK THE VEHICLE TO A DEALERSHIP AND HAD IT REPAIRED.  THE MECHANIC DID NOT TELL HIM WHY THE SHAFT BROKE. *JB

AFTER TRAVELING FOR LONG PERIODS OF TIME ON A HIGHWAY AND THEN SLOWING TO A STOP ON THE EXIT, THE VEHICLE HARD SHIFTS IN GEARS 1-2.  IF YOU SHUT OFF THE ENGINE, IT APPEARS OK UNTIL THE NEXT TIME.  TRANSMISSION FLUID IS OK.  VEHICLE ONLY HAS 47500 MILES.  HAD MECHANIC CHECK AND GETS COMPUTER CODE 1870, WITH ENGINE CHECK LIGHT ON.  NUMEROUS POSTS ON THE WEB HAVE SIMILAR COMPLAINTS ON CHEVY/GM VEHICLES WITH 4L60E TRANSMISSION, BUT NO RECALL TO DATE.  MAY NOW HAVE TO REPLACE TRANSMISSION.

DT: VEHICLE WAS PARKED AND WHEN PLACED KEY IN IGNITION  DRIVER'S SIDE AIR BAG DEPLOYED ONTO DRIVER.   VEHICLE HAD BEEN ESTIMATED AT AN INSURANCE CLAIM AGENCY FOR INSPECTION OF PRIOR HAIL DAMAGE.  NO LIGHTS WERE DISPLAYED TO WARN AND NO LIGHTS ILLUMINATED   AFTERWARDS AS WELL.  HAVE NOT YET TAKEN TO DEALER, PLANS TO CONTACT GENERAL MOTORS.  *AK
PASSENGER DOORS HINGES ARE STICKING

VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN THE GARAGE,  UPON ENTERING THE VEHICLE,  THE DRIVER SIDE AIR BAG DEPLOYED. MANUFACTURER STATED THAT  VEHICLE HAD TO BE INSPECTED TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE.   CONSUMER RECEIVED A CALL FROM MANUFACTURER, INFORMING HIM   THAT CONSUMER WAS RESPONSIBLE TO PAY THE REPAIR COSTS.  *AK

NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR ON ALLOY WHEELS SHOULD NOT RESULT IN THE SEVERE CORROSION I HAVE ON MY WHEELS.  I DON'T KNOW IF THERE IS A FAILURE RISK, BECAUSE I AM NOT A METALLURGICAL ENGINEER, BUT THE CORROSION IS SUBSTANTIAL.  IT LOOKS TO ME LIKE THE CLEAR COATING ON THE WHEEL HAS TRAPPED MOISTURE AND ROAD SALT, ALLOWING THE ACCELERATED CORROSION.  I HAVE EMAILED AMERICAN RACING AND I HAVE BEEN IGNORED.  *JB
SEVERE ALLOY WHEEL CORROSION ON ALL WHEELS. *JB

WHILE APPLYING THE BRAKES BRAKE LIGHTS/TURN SIGNALS AND OTHER ELECTRICAL SYSTEM  PARTS  FAILED TO COME ON.  CONSUMER REPLACED THE FUSE AND BULBS ON NUMEROUS OCCASIONS, BUT PROBLEM RECURRED. CONSUMER DROVE VEHICLE TO DEALER FOR INSPECTION, BUT MECHANIC  COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  *AK

THE VEHICLE STALLED WHILE DRIVING.  THE DRIVER WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER THEN DROVE THE VEHICLE HOME.  THE DRIVER SMELLED BURNING WIRES COMING THROUGH THE VENTS.  THE CAUSE HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.  *NM

I TOOK MY VAN IN UNDER WARRANTY BECAUSE MY ABS DOESN'T WORK.  MY REAR AXLE CLANKS AND WINDS.  TWO WEEKS AFTER I BOUGHT IT THESE PROBLEMS STARTED TO OCCURED.  I TOOK MY VAN INTO THE DEALER SHIP RIGHT AWAY AND  THEY REPLACED MY REAR AXLE.  THE PROBLEM WITH THE AXLE STILL EXISTS BUT WAS WORSE  AFTER THE REPLACEMENT OF THE AXLE.  THE PROBLEM IS PROGRESSING AND I WILL BE IN NEED OF A NEW AXLE SOON AND HAVE NEVER HAD ABS SINCE I HAVE OWNED THE VAN AND THE DEALERSHIP WOULDN'T REPAIR THE PROBLEMS. THEY TELL US THERE IS NOTHING WRONG WITH THE ABS OR THE REAR AXLE. THEY TESTED MY BRAKES BY DRIVING MY VAN AROUND THE PARKING LOT. MY FRONT BRAKES ARE SPONGY AND THEY LOCK UP ON WET ROADS WHEN BRAKING HARD.  THIS IS A 1999 CHEVY EXPRESS VAN.  WE ALSO PURCHASED A 1999 CHEVY MONTE CARLO SIGHT UNSEEN AT THE SAME TIME WE PURCHASED OUR EXPRESS VAN. WE HAD PROBLEMS WITH THE FRONT END ALIGNMENT OF THE MONTE CARLO AND IT WAS THE TREAD OFF OF THE LEFT FRONT TIRE AFTER TWO THOUSAND MILES. THEY KEPT TELLING US THERE WAS NOTHING WRONG WITH THE ALIGNMENT AFTER TAKING THE CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP NUMEROUS TIMES.  JIM COX TRIED TO TELL US THAT MY WIFE MADE TOO MANY LEFT HAND TURNS AND INSULTED MY WIFE ABOUT HER WEIGHT  NEITHER VEHICLES WERE EVER TITLED BEFORE WE PURCHASED THEM.  PROBLEMS ON BOTH VEHICLES STARTED TO OCCUR IMMEDIATLY AND WE HAVE HAD NOTHING BUT TROUBLE WITH TRYING TO GET THE WARRANTY WORK DONE ON THEM.  NOW THE WARRANTY HAS EXPIRED AND THE PROBLEMS I HAVE HAD WITH MY VAN STILL EXISTS AND IS BECOMING INCREASINGLY WORSE.  JIM COX WAS THE AREA SERVICE REPRESENATIVE FOR ALL OF CENTRAL FLORIDA CHEVY DEALERSHIPS AND TOLD THE SERVICE  MANAGER "IF IT'S NOT BROKE DON'T FIX IT" AND HE HAD NO PROBLEM STATING THAT RIGHT IN FRONT OF MY WIFE AND MYSELF.  CALLED HEAD OFFICE  THAY DID NOT WHONT TO NKOW,  NEVER EVER BUY CHEVE EVER  EVER AGAIN.  *AK
PAINT FLAKING ON MIRRORS AND BUMBERS AND TRIM

WHILE DRIVING LEFT FRONT BRAKE  MALFUNCTIONED, CAUSING EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE.  DEALERSHIP  TRIED TO REPAIR THE PROBLEM 15 TIMES BEFORE, BUT HAD NOT YET RESOLVED THE PROBLEM. THIS PROBLEM SWITCHED LOCATION AFTER REPAIRS. *AK

CONSUMER COMPLAINED ABOUT   A PROBLEM WITH THE DRIVER'S SEAT.  THE BRACKET THAT MOUNTS THE SEAT KEEPS CRACKING. OWNER TOOK VEHICLE TO THE DEALERSHIP. DEALER INSISTS THAT IT IS  A DEFECT IN THE DESIGN  THAT CAUSES THE BRACKET TO CRACK.  *AK

DRIVER SAID VAN WAS RUNNING ROUGH AND WHITE SMOKE  CAME OUT OF THE TAIL PIPE. TOOK VEHICLE TO MECHANIC.  MECHANIC  STATED ANTIFREEZE WAS LEAKING INTO THE MANIFOLD.  *AK              THREE HEAD BOLTS ON DRIVER'S SIDE WAS LOOSE. THIS ALLOWED ANTI FREEZE TO LEAK INTO THE NO. 1 CYLINDER. IT WAS CAUGHT EARLY ENOUGH SO THAT THE HEAD WAS NOT DAMAGED. IT HAS TO BE REMOVED, CHECKED FOR CRACKS AND RE-INSTALLED WITH NEW GASKETS FOR $1100.00 DOLLARS.   *PH   *NLM

AFTER THE VEHICLE HAD BEEN DRIVEN  CONSUMER WOULD RETURN TO RESTART IT FROM MINUTES TO HOURS, AND VEHICLE WOULD NOT START.  THIS  HAPPENED INTERMITTENTLY, ABOUT SIX TIMES.  AT THIS TIME NEITHER THE MANUFACTURER OR THE DEALERSHIP HAVE BEEN INFORMED.  *AK
THE DOME LIGHT WENT OUT SUDDENLY, ALL BACK WIRES WERE MELTED. DEALER NOTIFIED.*AK

WIRING HARNESS UNDER FUSE BLOCK AT DRIVERS FEET NOT PROPERLY SECURED BY S-CLIP AND WIRES RUB AGAINST ACCESS HOLE IN SHEET METAL CAUSING SHORT IN TURN SIGNAL OR 4-WAY FLASHER CIRCUIT CAUSING FIRE.  VEHICLE IS MARK III CONVERSION.   *NLM

WHILE DRIVING BACK FROM A FIELD TRIP IN OUR 15-PASSENGER VAN FULL OF CHILDREN, THE STEELTEX R4S TIRE HAD A BLOWOUT AND TREAD SEPARATION.  BY SOME SORT OF MIRACLE OUR DRIVER, GOING 55 MPH ON THE HIGHWAY, MANAGE TO KEEP CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE.  THANKFULLY ALL THE CHILDREN ARE SAFE,BUT I AM EXTREMELY CONCERNED THAT I WAS UNAWARE OF OTHER COMPLAINTS REGARDING THESE TIRES.  I WOULD HAVE NEVER LET THE CHILDREN RIDE IN THE VAN WITH THOSE TIRES IF I KNEW THE PROBLEMS WITH THEM.  THERE WAS SOME DAMAGE TO THE DRIVE SHAFT DUE TO THE BLOWOUT, BUT THE VEHICLE IS STILL IN THE REPAIR, SO I DON'T KNOW HOW THE DAMAGE OCCURRED.   *NLM
STEERING WHEEL SHAKES WHEN BRAKE ARE APPLIED.  THIRD SET OF FRONT BRAKES IN 65,000 MILES.  ROTORS TURNED EACH TIME.  *NLM
THE SIDE DOOR DID NOT UNLOCK FROM INSIDE OR OUTSIDE DUE TO DAMAGED HINGE.  *JB
THE RIGHT REAR TIRE EXPERIENCED TREAD SEPARATION. WHICH CAUSED THE TIRE TO BLOW OUT.*JB

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING
summary: THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER FAILED.  *JB  THIS WAS THE CONVERTER PLACED IN THIS VEHICLE.  THE CONSUMER WAS TEST DRIVING WHEN HE FELT A SLUGGISHNESS AND HEARD A RATTLING NOISE WHICH OCCURRED UPON ACCELERATION AND IN THE EXHAUST.  AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED, THE CONSUMER FELT THE SAME PROBLEM(S) AGAIN.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE PART WAS DEFECTIVE.  THE CONSUMER HAD TAKEN THE VEHICLE TO TWO OTHER DEALERS AND WAS TOLD THAT THE CONVERTER WAS NEVER CHANGED, ONLY THE DOUGHNUTS WERE REPLACED.  THE CONVERTER WAS REPLACED BY LARRY H. MILLER.  ALSO, THE BRAKES HAD BECOME INOPERATIVE AND WERE REPLACED.  SCC

HINGES ON REAR SIDE DOOR STICKS. BAD DESIGN. UNABLE TO GREASE THOROUGHLY. I CAN ONLY IMAGINE THAT SOMEWHERE DOWN THE ROAD THIS WILL LOCK AND THE HINGE WILL DETACH FROM THE SIDE OF THE VAN. THIS IS THE SECOND OF THE TWO SIDE DOORS THE ONE CLOSER TO THE REAR OF THE VAN.
POSITIVE BATTERY BOLT CAME OUT OF BATTERY CAUSING LEAK AND RENDERING BATTERY USELESS. SOUNDS LIKE A MAJOR FACTORY DEFECT. (NOT CABLE FROM BOLT - BUT BOLT OUT OF BATTERY)
WHILE DRIVING THE RIGHT REAR TIRE BLEW OUT.  PLEASE PROVIDE MORE DETAILS.        TS

WHILE DRIVING AT ANY SPEED AND NO WARNING THE VEHICLE WILL SHUT OFF CAUSING THE CONSUMER TO PULL OVER OFF THE ROAD. CONSUMER STATES IS THE FUEL INJECTION PUMP WHICH IS CAUSING THE PROBLEM. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION. TS

WHEN THE GAS PEDAL IS RELEASED, IT TAKES 10-15 SECONDS FOR THE FUEL INJECTION TO SHUT OFF, AND THE PEDAL STICKS WHEN TRYING TO ACCELERATE FROM A DEAD STOP, CREATING A DANGEROUS SITUATION. BOTH VISITS TO TWO DIFFERENT DEALERS PRODUCED NO RESULTS AND I WAS TOLD "NO PROBLEM FOUND."  DT
A/C UNIT WORKS, HOWEVER DUE TO SHORT CYCLE EXCESSIVE WEAR OCCURS TO A/C AND ENGINE.
WHILE DRIVING AT ABOUT 30 MPH, THE DRIVERS AIR BAGS DEPLOYED WITHOUT ANY WARNING, CAUSING INJURY. CONTACTED DEALER, AND DEALER WAS NOT WILLING TO DO ANYTHING.*AK *JB

SIDE DOOR HINGE HAS FROZEN.  DOOR WILL NOT OPEN OR CLOSE. *AK  CONSUMER STATES THAT THIS HINGE FAILURE CAUSED THE WHEELCHAIR LIFT EQUIPMENT TO NOT WORK PROPERLY, THE HINGE HAS BEEN REPLACED, HOWEVER AT CONSUMERS COST.   *SLC
WHILE LOADING VEHICLE THROUGH THE SIDE DUAL DOORS  LOWER HINGE BROKE IN TWO. DOOR WILL SHUT.  HOWEVER, DOES NOT FEEL DOOR IS PROPERLY SECURED.*AK

BATTERY HAS BEEN CHANGED 3 TIMES WITHIN THE LAST YEAR IN A HALF.  NEW BATTERIES, THAT WERE REPLACEMENTS, WERE DYING OUT AS QUICKLY AS 2 DAYS AGO.  ELECTRICAL JUICE DRAINED AFTER VEHICLE HAS BEEN SITTING A WHILE.  PROBLEM HASN'T BEEN RECTIFIED .*AK  *MJ

FRONT BRAKES HAVE FAILED AND HAVE BEEN REPLACED 5 TIMES.  1ST TIME OCT 21,1999 AT 5,910 MILES, 2ND TIME DEC 14,1999 AT 8,267 MILES, 3RD TIME JUL 22,2000 AT 17,821 MILES, 4TH TIME FEB 15,2001 AT 27,323 MILES, 5TH TIME MAR 11,2002 AT 32,568 MILES. *AK
THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER WAS REPLACED AT 27831 ON 5/4/01; AT 40373 ON 10/26/01 AND IT IS AGAIN BAD AS OF THIS CONTACT.*AK

WHILE DRIVING AT A SPEED OF 65MPH ON THE HIGHWAY, MY VAN HAS COMPLETELY LOST ALL OPERATION.  MY CAR QUITS RUNNING, STEERING FREEZES UP AND I LOSE MY BRAKES.  THE CAR COMPLETELY FREEZE UP.  I HAVE HAD IT TOWED  TWICE IN 2 WEEKS FOR THIS CONDITION.  THE MECHANIC SAID A FUSE BLOWS IN THE COMPUTER.  THEY CANNOT FIND A SHORT OR ANY REASON FOR THE PROBLEM.  I AM AFRAID TO DRIVE THE CAR ON THE HIGHWAY NOW.  I NEVER KNOW WHEN IT WILL COMPLETELY DIE WHILE DRIVING.  WHAT CAN IT BE?  THE MECHANIC RAN DIAGNOSTIC TESTING AND THINKS IT COULD BE SOMETHING CALLED ECM.  BUT HE IS NOT SURE.  WHAT DO I NEED TO DO?*AK

BRAKES ARE EXTREEMELY SPONGY AND FADE SIGNIFICANTLY REQUIRING FAR GREATER STOPPING DISTANCE THAN ANYTHING I'VE EVER DRIVEN. PUMPING THE PEDAL SEEMS TO HELP BUT PUSHING  FIRMLY  ACTIVATES THE ABS WHICH CAUSES VEHICLE TO LURCH TOWARD WHATEVER IS IN FRONT OF YOU. I'VE NEVER DRIVEN A VEHICLE WHERE THE ABS KICKS IN SO FREQUENTLY.  *AK

DEALER FAULTING NORMAL WEAR AND TEAR TO OFFSET REAL PROBLEM BUT AFTER FIXING THE PROBLEM TO HAVE IT REOCCUR IN 15000 MILES . NOW DEALER  IS SAYING BRAKES DONT WEAR THE SAME FROM RIGHT TO LEFT SIDE . LEFT SIDE HAD .180 THOUSANTHS WHILE THE RIGHT SIDE HAD 0.ALARMING ISN'T IT ? DO THEY ACTUALLY WANT US THE PUBLIC TO BELIEVE THIS. PLEASE  ADDRESS THIS ISSUE WITH THEM AS THEY ARE RELUCTANT TO RELIZE THEIR MISTAKE. *AK
WHILE DRIVING THE TRANSMISSION FAILED, CONSUMER WAS INFORMED BY DEALER THAT THE SUN GEAR IN THE TRANSMISSION HAD GONE OUT.*JB
WHILE DRIVING THE TRANSMISSION FAILED, CONSUMER WAS INFORMED BY DEALER THAT THE SUN GEAR IN THE TRANSMISSION HAD GONE OUT.*JB

BOTH EXTERIOR MIRRORS WOULD VIBRATE SEVERELY WHILE TRAVELING AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS OF 50 OR MORE. THIS CONDITION CAUSES VERY POOR VISIBILITY.  DEALER WAS NOTIFIED ,AND WAS UNABLE TO CORRECT PROBLEM. PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS ON THIS MATTER.  *AK

TIRE HAD COMPLETE CASTASTROPHIC FAILURE OF THE SIDE WALL WHILE ON HIGHWAY DRIVING 54 MPH. THE ENTIRE SIDE WALL BLEW OUT. THIS TIRE HAD LESS THAN 15 DAYS DRIVING TIME ON IT SINCE IT WAS THE SPARE THAT WAS REPLACED ON MONDAY, 21 MAY.  THE ONLY OTHER TIME IT WAS USED WAS FOR 2 DAYS LAST SUMMER.  THE TIRE WAS BRAND NEW!!!*AK (DOT NUMBER: 120/116R  TIRESIZE: LT24575R16)

BOTH DRIVER SIDE AND PASSENGER SIDE EXTERNAL MIRRORS VIBRATE EXCESSIVELY AT SPEEDS IN EXCESS OF 50MPH.  THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT AT MY DEALERSHIP HAS REPLACED BOTH MIRRORS SEVERAL TIMES BUT HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO CORRECT THE DEFECT.  I HAVE CONTACTED CHEVROLET/GM AND THEY DO NOT FEEL THAT THIS ISSUE IS A DEFECT AND HAVE STATED THAT THE VIBRATION IS "NORMAL AND INHERENT TO THE DESIGN OF THE VEHICLE."  A GM REPRESENTATIVE MET WITH ME AT MY DEALERSHIP TO TEST DRIVE MY VEHICLE AND A NEW COMPARABLE MODEL TO DEMONSTRATE THAT ALL CHEVROLET EXPRESS VANS HAVE THE SAME TYPE OF "NORMAL" VIBRATION.  THEY HAVE STATED THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE A FIX BECAUSE THEY DO NOT FEEL THAT THIS IS A SAFETY ISSUE AND HAVE STATED THAT NO ONE ELSE IS COMPLAINING ABOUT THE MIRRORS.  I DISAGREE.  THERE HAVE BEEN NUMEROUS CONSUMER DEFECT COMPLAINTS REPORTED TO NHTSA SINCE 1995 WHEN THE MODEL WAS FIRST INTRODUCED YET CHEVROLET/GM HAS NEGLECTED TO CORRECT OR RE-DESIGN THEIR DEFFECTIVE MIRRORS.  THE MIRROR'S VIBRATION IS NOT "NORMAL".  THIS VIBRATION IS A SERIOUS SAFETY HAZARD BECAUSE THE MIRRORS ARE COMPLETELY USELESS AT NORMAL HIGHWAY SPEEDS.  PLEASE HELP CORRECT THIS SAFETY ISSUE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.*AK
VEHICLE WAS IN PARK MODE AND WHEN DEPRESSING  EMERGENCY BRAKE VEHICLE WOULD STILL TRAVEL. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION. *AK
PE00 020; CONSUMER WAS LOADING UP  TRUCK AND NOTICED THAT PASSENGER'S REAR TIRE HAD A CHUNK OF THE TREAD GONE.    FIRESTONE, STEEL TEX, R4SLT245/75R16 , DOT#23570URBNO5326-1  DOT VN11B1A338. *AK  *JB

NUT ON  STEERING COLUMN FELL OF, CAUSING LOSS OF STEERING.*AK  AN ARM ON THE PPWER STEERING CYLINDER IS BOLTED THAT CONNECTED TO THE FRONT WHEELS, THE NUT ON THE BOLT DROPPED OFF CAUSING AN INSTANTANEOUS LOSS OF ALL STEERING CONTROL, THERE WERE NO INJURIES.*JB
WHILE INSTALLING CSS REAR SEAT BELT WILL NOT LOCK IN PLACE. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

I DON'T KNOW IF EITHER PROBLEM IS DANGEROUS.  I DO KNOW IM WORRIED TO LET MY WIFE DRIVE THIS VEHICLE  WITH MY CHILDREN INIT. AS FAR AS THE BRAKES ARE CONCERNED, THE CHEVROLET SERVICE MANAGER AND CHEVROLET  TELL ME ITS NORMAL  FOR THIS TO OCCUR TWICE  ON A VAN WITH ONLY 22,000MILES?A FTERFOR THIS.  *AK
TREAD SEPARATION AFTER LOUD NOISE. (THOUGHT A JET WAS GOING OVERHEAD). FELT NO VIBRATION OR ANYTHING ELSE PRIOR TO TIRE GOING FLAT.*AK (DOT NUMBER: CANADA  TIRESIZE: LT245/7516)
BOTH TIRES RECENTLY ROTATED FROM BACK TO FRONT, NOTICED BOTH FRONT TIRES ARE SEPARATED. MY ADDRESS IS CANMORE, AB CANADA T1W 1K9.  *AK (TIRESIZE: 245/75R16)( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 245/75R16 )

APPROXIMATELY 6 WEEKS AGO I NOTICED THAT THE AIR PRESSURE IN MY TIRES HAD LOWERED, & I SHOUGHT WITH THE WEIGHT VARIANCE THAT THERE WASN'T A PROBLEM.  I CONTACTED FIRESTONE, & THEY HAD INFORMED ME OF NO RECALL.  THE PROBLEM CONTINUES, & I STOPPED BY JENOR TIRE IN THIENSVILLE, WI, & THEY INFORMED ME THAT MY FRONT RIGHT TIRE WAS SHOWING SIGNS OF SEPERATION.  I PLAN ON HAVING NEW GOODYEAR TIRES INSTALLED ON MY VAN ON OCT. 3, 2000 (TIRESIZE: LT24575R16)( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: LT24575R16 )
THE DOUBLE PLUG HAPPENED WITHIN IN A WEEK OF PURCHASE, THE TREAD MISSING WAS ON THE SPARE RIGHT AWAY, WHICH WE SHARE NOW DRIVING ON.*AK (TIRESIZE: 16)( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 16 )

THE SPEEDOMETER NEEDLE STICKS AFTER SEVERAL HOURS OF DRIVING (LONG TRIPS).  THE NEEDLE HAS STAYED STUCK AT 70 MPH WHEN COMMING OFF OF THE EXPRESSWAY UNTIL ALMOST AT A COMPLETE STOP.  IT HAS ALSO STAYED AT 20 - 30 MPH WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS GOING ABOUT 50 MPH.  DEALER AND CHEVY WILL NOT AUTHORIZE REPAIRS UNTIL CONDITION CAN BE REPLICATED BY THE SERVICE DEPT.  GIVEN THE INTERMITTENT NATURE OF THIS IMPORTANT SAFETY DEVICE FAILURE, IT IS NO LONGER SAFE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE FOR LONG PERIODS.  UNRELATED PROBLEM, BOTH OUTSIDE REAR VIEW MIRRORS VIBRATE IN THE WIND MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO SEE OBJECTS IN THEM.  *AK
WHEEL SEAL LEAKS COATING REAR BRAKES WITH OIL . *AK

VEHICLE EXPERIENCED AN ELECTRICAL SHORT IN THE COURTESY LIGHT WHILE DRIVING, WHEN ALL SWITCHES WERE IN AN OFF POSITION. OWNER PULLED VEHICLE OVER AND  DISCONNECTED THE LIGHT. DEALER NOTIFIED, CONSUMER CURRENTLY WAITING FOR PART NEEDED FOR REPAIR. *AK *ML
BRAKES REPAIRED ON TWO OCCASIONS, HOWEVER STILL DO NOT WORK PROPERLY.  *MJS

WHEN  CONSUMER PASSES A CAR  BOTH REARVIEW MIRRORS   VIBRATE BADLY, CAUSING BLURRING VISION THROUGH THE MIRRORS.  IT'S VERY HARD TO  SEE  VEHICLES BEHIND.  THIS PROBLEM IS ALMOST UNBEARABLE AT NIGHT TIME BECAUSE HEADLIGHTS IN THE MIRRORS ARE NOW LIKE STROKE LIGHTS COMING FROM BOTH SIDES.  *AK
I AM NOT A SATISFIED CUSTOMER AND NO ONES WANTS TO HELP ME. I WANT A REPLACEMENT. I DON'T FELL SAFE ON THE HIGHWAY....

FRONT SPRING FAILED CAUSING NOISE. MJS
WHILE COMING TO A STOP THE BRAKES WILL FADE OUT AND PEDAL WILL GO TO THE FLOOR.  *AK

POWER STEERING LINE CAME LOOSE,  CAUSING A LOSS OF FLUID.  REPORTED THIS PROBLEM TO NHTSA,  HOPING THAT IT CAN BE CORRECTED  IF IT  HAPPENED TO ANOTHER CONSUMER.  *AK     POWER TO BRAKES HYDRAULICK SYSTEM AS WELL AS POWER STEERING. *MJS
AFTER ENGINE IS HOT AND SITTING OVER AN HOUR,WHEN STARTED BACK UP IT KNOCKS LIKE THE MAIN BEARING DONT HAVE OIL THEN THE OIL PRESURE HITS AND THE LIFTERS RATTLE FOR THE NEXT MINUTE OR SO
